result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin P. Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin P. Higgins

records.addlTxt: *Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court, except Defendant may leave the State of Wisconsin for recreational purposes.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

Defendant Martin P. Higgins in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Atty Tlusty.  Victim notification complied.  DE entered a plea of guilty to Ct. 2.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty.  Pursuant to the agreement the court deferred entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of one year on Ct. 2.  Court order Ct.1 be dismissed but read in.   Brief comments from Atty Tlusty and Atty Casey.  DE makes statement.  Court accepted the agreement and signed the same. Court modifies bond so Defendant can leave the state for recreational purposes. ba
Plea hearing on September 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Victim request and order to remove no contact from Defendant's bond
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with the booking procedures. Defendant shall have no contact with T.M.H.-dob: 12-05-1975.

Defendant Martin P. Higgins in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Attorney Casey is requesting that the bond be modified to a signature bond.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court modifies bond to a $150.00 cash bond with a $3,000.00 signature bond same conditions as previously ordered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm. - rt

DAR started at 10:03:44.   Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $500.00 cash bond and a $3,000.00 signature bond with conditions of: booking; no contact with T.M.H. dob: 12-5-1975. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.
